channel.title: Code Optional
channel.description: Three engineering comrades – Andrew Sardone, Kevin Vitale, and Chris Dzombak – talk about development, design, and shipping apps. There's a heavy slant towards Apple tech, balanced with general inquiries around programming and the intricacies/inanities of software.
channel.itunes:author: Andrew Sardone, Kevin Vitale, Chris Dzombak
channel.itunes:summary: Three engineering comrades – Andrew Sardone, Kevin Vitale, and Chris Dzombak – talk about development, design, and shipping apps. There's a heavy slant towards Apple tech, balanced with general inquiries around programming and the intricacies/inanities of software.

item.title: 7: Our first ever guest, designing remotely
item.description: While Kevin takes the afternoon off for some well-deserved family and petting zoo time, we're joined by our guest Karsten Rowe. Karsten is a UK-based designer, and together with Andrew and Chris he chats about remote work, jumping from graphic to product design, and how one grows and becomes inspired.
item.itunes:author: Andrew Sardone, Kevin Vitale, Chris Dzombak
item.itunes:summary: While Kevin takes the afternoon off for some well-deserved family and petting zoo time, we're joined by our guest Karsten Rowe. Karsten is a UK-based designer, and together with Andrew and Chris he chats about remote work, jumping from graphic to product design, and how one grows and becomes inspired.

item.title: 6: Unfulfilled Promises
item.description: Chris has an announcement, followed by a quick discussion about OS X Yosemite and iOS 8. From there, Andrew, Chris, and Kevin go back and forth on Promises and why they're an insufficient abstraction.
item.itunes:author: Andrew Sardone, Kevin Vitale, Chris Dzombak
item.itunes:summary: Chris has an announcement, followed by a quick discussion about OS X Yosemite and iOS 8. From there, Andrew, Chris, and Kevin go back and forth on Promises and why they're an insufficient abstraction.

item.title: 4: We did talk about Core Data!
item.description: On this episode, Kevin throws in a big announcement, followed by a group discussion on Swift's nil coalescing operator and the common applications of Core Data.
item.itunes:author: Andrew Sardone, Kevin Vitale, Chris Dzombak
item.itunes:summary: On this episode, Kevin throws in a big announcement, followed by a group discussion on Swift's nil coalescing operator and the common applications of Core Data.

item.title: 3: So we didn't talk about Core Data
item.description: Andrew, Kevin, and Chris plan to talk about Core Data. Instead, they discuss navigation patterns for iOS apps.
item.itunes:author: Andrew Sardone, Kevin Vitale, Chris Dzombak
item.itunes:summary: Andrew, Kevin, and Chris plan to talk about Core Data. Instead, they discuss navigation patterns for iOS apps.

item.title: 2: Frameworks, you guys don't even know how many sunshine and rainbows
item.description: Andrew, Chris, and Kevin sit down for a chat on "Google becoming Apple" (or so Kevin says), and how dynamic frameworks for third party developers will replace CocoaPods (or so Kevin says).
item.itunes:author: Andrew Sardone, Kevin Vitale, Chris Dzombak
item.itunes:summary: Andrew, Chris, and Kevin sit down for a chat on "Google becoming Apple" (or so Kevin says), and how dynamic frameworks for third party developers will replace CocoaPods (or so Kevin says).

item.title: 1: We started this new project in Swift
item.description: Andrew, Chris, and Kevin sit down for their inaugural chat, scratching the surface of Swift.
item.itunes:author: Andrew Sardone, Kevin Vitale, Chris Dzombak
item.itunes:summary: Andrew, Chris, and Kevin sit down for their inaugural chat, scratching the surface of Swift.
